items.item_name: Glycine clandestina (very rare form from Dunolly area)

leads.lead_text: Leaflets sessile to subsessile; petiolules of uniform length, lacking stipels or with stipels minute and soon deciduous

Leaflets stalked; central petiolule longer than laterals (basal leaves sometimes with uniform petiolules in Glycine microphylla); at least the central leaflet subtended by a pair of often-persistent stipels.
Stems elongate, twining; leaflets linear, lanceolate or elliptic; seed c. 1.5 mm long
Stems short, erect, decumbent or ascending, never twining; leaflets obovate to orbicular; seed c. 3 mm long
Stems silky-strigose; apex of mature pod curved upwards before dehiscence; far north-west Victoria only
Stems glabrous to hirsute; apex of mature pod more or less straight
Leaflet reticulation obscure; leaflets with secondary veins at 30–45° to midrib; pod 7–13-seeded
Leaflet reticulation usually obvious; leaflets with secondary veins at 30–80° to midrib; pod 2–7 seeded
Stems twining; leaflets with length:width ratio of 2–7:1; leaflets normally with secondary veins at 60–80° to midrib, the 3 leaflets similar in size and shape; leaf rachis often <2 mm long

Stems trailing; leaflets with length:width ratio of 1.6–4:1; leaflets with secondary veins at  30–60° (rarely to 70°) to midrib, terminal leaflet often larger and longer than laterals; leaf rachis often >2 mm long
